info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 10:16PM PST until November 21 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, southeast Santa Barbara County and western Ventura County.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM PST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain falling across the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Urban and small stream flooding is likely. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ventura, Ojai, Carpinteria, Rose Valley, La Conchita, Meiners Oaks, Highway 33 between Wheeler Springs and Rose Valley Road, Lake Casitas, Reyes Peak, Solimar Beach, and Old Man Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST FRIDAY
